verbose_text: Levels of ammonium and nitrate were significantly higher (P < 0.05) in the sandy soils in June and September of 2009 (N - NH4+ : 13.6 +/- 0.97 and 2.3 +/- 0.15 mg kg -1, respectively; N - NO3- : 103.3 +/- 11.20 and 52.4 +/- 8.41 mg kg -1, respectively), and no significant difference in the OM content was found between sandy and clayey soils at any of the sampling times.
